title: Ticket #4632: Documentation for SIZE field of condor_q is misleading
description:
The manual entry for condor_q: 

   SIZE - The value of job ClassAd attribute MemoryUsage (in Mbytes), when the
attribute is defined, and ImageSize (in Kbytes), otherwise.

This is confusing, incomplete, and (I think) inaccurate as evidenced by user confusion in ticket 38026 to CHTC-requests.

The documentation above implies that SIZE could be in Mbytes or Kbytes, when in fact I think it is always in Mbytes. It also never gives the "big picture", but instead just gives the gritty-low-level info. Suggest it say instead something like: 

   SIZE - The peak amount of memory in megabytes consumed by the job; note this
 value is only refreshed periodically.  The actual value reported is taken from
 the job ClassAd attribute MemoryUsage if this attribute is defined, and from
 job attribute ImageSize otherwise.

TJ, please confirm what I am saying above is true, and if so, please correct the manual in the V8_2-branch (and merge forward). Also take a look at ticket 38026 in CHTC-requests and see if you think there is an additional problem beyond just misleading documentation.
